Spectacular video, it looks like paradise. My favorite food since I was a child is fruit. You guys are so lucky to have such an abundance of variety. I would be in heaven if I got to try fresh tropical excotic fruits.
Can I have the contact of your architect? Not for buildings but for the whole community project that you mentioned...
why did i think of Albert's wife Kirsten when i saw the name
This looks amazing, but I just can't imagine leaving my city comforts for something like this... I love the thought of eco living and growing things, but maybe I'm just not cut out for it :)
@Kristen & Siya Oh! Alright then! :)
That all exists here too :)
@Kristen & Siya What about modern entertainment and cinema and concerts and things? Once this whole pandemic is over, won't you miss easy access to things like that?
It all depends how u build ur home. U can  live in something very basic and rustic or more modern. The place we rented was extremely comfortable. We felt at home immediately.
I love this way of living! <3
@Kristen & Siya  Believe me, we appreciate it, Kristen! I'm holding the best for you, Siya & Kai, friends and your growing neighborhood. Be well!
It's so amazing isn't it? Yet it's really taking it back to basics. We're excited to share this journey with u all.
Beautiful guys!!! That jackfruit be lookin' gooo'!
So damn good!

@Kristen & Siya Oooh that sounds amazing ! I'd so rather be there right now, it 5 F (-15 C) outside. Been freezing ma buns making ice lanterns & balls & few shot glasses heh hee. I bet you guys will not miss the cold much :)

It's really a dream to be living in a food forest. Where there is unlimited food all year you can just pick off the tree. We've begun our home design and ita getting really exciting. Looking forward to sharing more with you.
